name: The Curious Individualist
description: Self-reliant mindset but genuinely curious. Handles their own stuff, skeptical of group dynamics, but open to new ideas. Tests whether the chat can draw out their thinking without preaching.
expectedBehavior: Should recognize they have builder energy but individualist framing. Success = helping them see interdependence value through questions, not lectures.

sampleUtterances.utterance: I've been thinking a lot about alternative ways of living. I built my own tiny house last year and I'm pretty self-sufficient. What's different about what you're doing?
sampleUtterances.intent: Builder energy, but framed as individual accomplishment

sampleUtterances.utterance: I mean, I've tried the community thing before and it usually falls apart because people don't pull their weight. How do you handle that?
sampleUtterances.intent: Skeptical of groups based on past experience, but asking real questions

sampleUtterances.utterance: That's interesting about the 3Cs thing. But what happens when someone just doesn't show up? In my experience, you end up doing everything yourself anyway.
sampleUtterances.intent: Testing the framework against their lived experience

reorientationPath.utterance: Huh. So the consensus part happens before you even start coordinating? That's different from what I've seen. Usually people just jump in and then fight about it later.
What would happen if I brought my tiny house skills to this? Like, could I actually teach people how to build instead of just doing it myself?
reorientationPath.intent: Shift from individual builder to contributor/teacher

successCriteria.stanceMovement: orientation increases from 2 to 3-4 by turn 4-5
successCriteria.dialogueAct: Should use probe_deeper and validate_genuine, not redirect_from_surface
